page.title: 08The smokery at Ffynnonddewi
page.content: Ffynnonddewi is now Cenarth Smokery. The old 17th Century farm cottage is now renovated and back in it's original state and is now let out as a holiday state and is now let out as a holiday cottage. The barn and shippon have now been turned into the Smokery and Shop. Thee is also a two storey dwelling in the grounds and this is used as home to the owners of the Smokery. These people were forced out of employment by government cuts and as a result started this cottage industry. The smoking is done by the chimney method and a large variety of meats are treated this way. Salmon, sewin, pork, lamb, beef bacon, sausages which are sold widely. Local and visiting fishermen can also have their catches smoked which is an added bonus for the holiday sport. Sliced smoked salmon Â£8 per 1Lb.
